page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY CONTINUED
page.content:
19th Century contd.
Many Victorian relics eg.bits of pottery have been dug up from the area near the canal locally known as "THE BLACKIES".Digging for such items is now discouraged as the earth around is liable to collapse. Two watermills and a windmill were used to produce flour and needles.None survive,but the wood from Peterbrook Mill was re-used in Mill House on Peterbrook Road. James Webster built one of his factories on Colebrook Road and in 1879 he announced that he had invented ALUMINIUM.Lord Salisbury,then Prime Minister,visited the factory.Webster was offered a knighthood but refused it.
